newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia sees London Club debt closing in June.
newsitem.headline: Russia sees London Club debt closing in June.

text.p: Russia will close its entire debt to the London Club of commercial bank creditors in the first half of June, Deputy Finance Minister Mikhail Kasyanov said on Friday.
Russia is currently considering and sending reconciliation agreements to individual banks. It has so far finished reconciling on $12 billion of the debt, Kasyanov told Reuters.
"If we look realistically at how quickly we shall receive and consider agreements we can come to a conclusion that the closing date will be in the first half of June," he said.
Russia had earlier said that mid-April would be the closing date.
The minimum necessary sum for closing the London Club rescheduling is $20 billion.
Russia agreed in 1995 with the London Club to reschedule $35 billion in debts inherited from the Soviet Union and interest arrears for up to 25 years.
Russia named Bank of America as its agent for the principal of the debt.
